DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to examine the relationship between post-tetanic count (PTC) and time to first response to Train of four (TOF) stimulation during deep neuromuscular blockade induced by rocuronium.
DOC.brief_title: Modification of Posttetanic Count (PTC) for Monitoring Deep Neuromuscular Block II
DOC.criteria: ASA 13 General anaesthesia >1 hour Surgery in supine position with possibility of monitoring the neuromuscular blockade at the thumb (n.ulnaris stimulation). Written informed content Neuromuscular disorders, hepatic and renal dysfunction Medication expected to interfere with the neuromuscular blocking agent Allergy to any medication used during anaesthesia Body weight less or exceeding 20% of the ideal body weight Pregnancy or breastfeeding
